author: CBR
description:
Absolute Batman breaks Batman down to his core DNA, then rebuilds him with almost nothing “sacred” except what makes him Batman at a character level. 

In this Heroes Journey Podcast clip, Scott Snyder explains the thesis that means Absolute Batman can strip away the familiar “comfort features”: no wealth requirement, no cave requirement, and even the idea that Alfred or Robins are essential. 

The goal is a more intense underdog Batman (one kids can relate to) shaped by the fears today’s generation actually lives with, and with a Gotham power structure that makes “billionaire antagonists” feel plausible.

Batman exists to make you brave in the face of what you fear.

Chapters:
00:08 – Absolute Batman’s “burn it down” thesis
01:02 – Batman’s core: trauma into change
03:34 – Writing Batman for today’s kids
07:47 – The important photo that becomes the “totem”
09:10 – The big arc: Batman can’t do it alone
12:25 – Blockbuster fun, but built around justice

🎙️ Clip from CBR’s Heroes Journe
title: Batman Explained: Absolute Batman's Core Rebuild (w/ Scott Snyder)
